Erigones SDDC API 1.0 documentation

erigones_sddc_api.client

erigones_sddc_api.client¶

This module contains the Erigones SDDC API Client class used to access the Erigones SDDC HTTP API.

class erigones_sddc_api.client.Client(api_url='https://my.erigones.com/api', api_key=None, auth=None, timeout=None, ssl_verify=True)¶

Erigones SDDC API HTTP client.

Parameters:
  • api_url (str) – Erigones SDDC API base URL.
  • api_key (str) – Optional API key used to perform authenticated requests.
  • auth (tuple) – Optional auth tuple to enable Basic/Digest/Custom HTTP authentication.
  • timeout (float) – How long to wait for the server to send data before giving up (default: None).
  • ssl_verify (bool) – If True, the SSL cert will be verified (default: True).
create(resource, **kwargs)¶

Alias for post().

delete(resource, **kwargs)¶

Perform DELETE request to Erigones SDDC API.

get(resource, **kwargs)¶

Perform GET request to Erigones SDDC API.

is_authenticated()¶

Return True if api_key is set or authorization token was saved by the login() method.

login(username, password)¶

Login to Erigones SDDC API (POST /accounts/login) using username and password.

Parameters:
  • username (str) – Erigones SDDC username.
  • password (str) – Erigones SDDC password.
logout()¶

Logout from Erigones SDDC API (GET /accounts/logout).

options(resource, **kwargs)¶

Perform OPTIONS request to Erigones SDDC API.

ping()¶

GET /ping

post(resource, **kwargs)¶

Perform POST request to Erigones SDDC API.

put(resource, **kwargs)¶

Perform PUT request to Erigones SDDC API.

request(method, resource, timeout=None, stream=True, **params)¶
Perform request to server and return Response or
raise an ESAPIException. This method is used by all public request methods in this class.
Parameters:
  • method (str) – HTTP method.
  • resource (str) – Erigones SDDC API resource beginning with a slash (e.g. /vm/<hostname>).
  • timeout (int) – Optional timeout for the request (default None).
  • stream (bool) – Whether to wait for asynchronous API calls to finish (default True).
  • params (dict) – Request parameters internally translated into POST/PUT/DELETE JSON encoded data or GET query string.
Returns:

Response object.
Return type:

Response
Raise:

ESAPIException
set(resource, **kwargs)¶

Alias for put().
